author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin on Thursday said Chief Minister Jayalalithaa had taken up the issue of releasing the seven convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case keeping in mind the 2016 Assembly elections.

Asked about the objection raised by the Congress party in both Houses of Parliament against the State government's decision to release them, all Mr. Stalin would say was while DMK leader M. Karunanidhi had demanded their release on humanitarian grounds, Ms. Jayalalithaa had enacted a drama on the eve of elections.

“In the past she has given false promises. She has followed the same now,” he said.

Mr Stalin said the DMK had completed interviews with aspiring candidates in 154 constituencies and interviews will continue till March 7.

‘In the past she has given false promises. She has followed the same now’
title: Elections behind decision to release Rajiv convicts: Stalin
